newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australian wool prices expected to stabilise.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australian wool prices expected to stabilise.

text.p: Australian wool prices are expected to stabilise, Wesfarmers Dalgety Ltd said in its weekly market preview.
The eastern market indicator last week fell 15 cents to 552 cents a kg clean, while the western market indicator fell two cents to 532 cents a kg clean.
Sales this week are in Newcastle, Adelaide and Launceston with 91,000 bales on offer.
"Expectations that the A$ will remain abouve 80 cents to the U.S.$ , for the short term at least, are starting to negatively affect prices, the Australian Council of Wool Exporters said.

Wesfarmers said the rapid appreciation of the A$ against both the US$, peaking at 81.48 cents, and the yen, reaching a four year high at 92.05, was a major deterrent and will continue to have a large effect on the broad wool end of the market.
"The recognition that these prices are at record low levels is expected to stimulate buying activity and and sharp grower resistance to lower prices will prevent prices falling further.
Most recent futures market activity supports this, with a discontinuation of the downward trend and prices now bouncing off levels of support," Wesfarmers said.
